titles.title: A concurrent resolution to recognize the International Association of Fire Fighters and the National Fallen Fire Fighter Memorial in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Rules.
Senate Committee on Rules discharged by Unanimous Consent.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 210.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to House Committee on House Administration.
Referred to Subcommittee on Libraries and Memorials.
House Committee on House Administration Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Resolution Agreed to in House (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate agreed to House amendments by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 10/27/1987--Passed House amended. (Measure passed House, amended, in lieu of H.Con.Res. 87) Recognizes the memorial to be built in Colorado Springs, Colorado, in honor of fire fighters who have died in the line of duty, as the International Association of Fire Fighters Fallen Fire Fighter Memorial.
